intro: Astragalus aureus var. chromolepis, commonly known as the golden milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the western United States. It features upright, branching stems covered in soft, gray-green foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its small, lens-shaped seeds are encased in a leathery pod. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
